div.p:
I am obliged to you for your at
tention in sending me the
proof sheets of my little story
Except the few corrections I send
I donotdo not see any thing that re
quiresrequires alteration -I could wish the titles to the chapters left on You wrote
on the back 2n title - Garryowen
is the best title I can thinkof
for the story - If you meant
a title for the volume perhaps
Christmas Stories" might do

I feel a point of conscience
to tell you that I do not think
the ghost story of Adam Willy Bell
which you propose publishing
along with Garryowen is fit
for children - It is beautifully
written - But so much the worse -
- It will make the more impress
sionimpression - I positively know that
numbers of parents have objected
to that story and would not
Mr Wilson 1 North Audley Street
put into the hands of their children
the publication in which it
was - so that in that respect
it must hurt your interest -
- Mr Lockhart is a particular
friend of mine and no one
can admire his genius or
or his character more than I
do - but therefore nothing but
the real fear that the story
should do mischief to children
could induce me to object
to it - Publish it in some
book for grown up people
- and I don't care how much
they are frightened -

If you want any better
story to put in its place in
this story book for youngsters
I think perhaps one
which I gave to a friend
years ago (Mr Rev John Sneyd of Elford
Lichfield
of Staffordshire)
might suit you - Humphreys
was the name of the printer
or print seller by whom it
was published as well as I
recollect - The name of
the story is "Pretty Bob & Poor Bob" I think
- It was an ill used chimney
sweeper - It is about 8 or 10
It will do no harm that is all I can say for it
pages long - if you think it
worth inquiring for you must
apply to Mr. Sneyd
a joining map was made I believe
of Pretty Bob & Poor Bob

I have forwarded your note
to the author of Bertha from
whom you will of course
have an answer - I know
nought about the matter

I see you intend a wooden in
cut to Garryowen - If it be
not already done I wish
you would getyour a a design
from Mr. Lover - in Dublin
his 6 sketches in "Irish stories
and Legends" are capital
- truly good humor -
He is a drawing master and
- He is a drawing master and
any bookseller in Dublin
can find him for you
I know nothing in the world
of him but these sketches
and his writing -
both excellent! - I never
saw him
div.closer:
I am Dr.Dear Sir
Your Obedt Servt
Maria Edgeworth

postscript.p:
Miss Mackintosh told me that
my friend Sir James Mackintosh
had written to Mr. Murray a
few months before his death
to order for me a copy of his
or essay on metaphysics published
In one of the Encyclopedias - I never
have received it - I wish you could
get it for me & send it to my sister
